name: Slashing
effect: The target's DC is reduced by 2 until the start of their next turn.
sources: bladed weapons such as swords and axes, or the claws of wild animals.

name: Piercing
sources: arrows, spears, and swords, or the fangs of monsters.

name: Bludgeoning
effect: When a bludgeoning attack is blocked, the target still takes half damage.
sources: hammers, hooves or fists, and falling damage.

name: Heat
effect: The target gains one level of burning.
sources: burning creatures, pyromantic magic, or the breath of dragons.

name: Cold
effect: The target gains one level of freezing.
sources: frost spells or environmental hazards such as blizzards or icy water.

name: Force
effect: Liable to knock the target prone.

name: Lightning
effect: Deals 1 Deals half damage versus opponents wearing metal armor.

name: Acid
effect: Erodes armor. Target BC is reduced by 1 if the attack is not dodged.
sources: bile, acidic venom, and certain alchemical mixtures.

name: Poison
effect: Carries with it additional effects dependant on the type of poison.
sources: poisoned blades, the claws and fangs of venomous beasts, and certain spells.

name: Holy
effect: An extraordinarily bright light of divine origin. Deals double damage to evil and the undead, but only half to good.
sources: radiant lights, solar astrology, and theurgical summons.

name: Profane
effect: A sickening miasma of spiritual darkness. Deals double damage to good-aligned creatures, but only half to evil.
sources: lunar astrology, necromantic spells, and demonic summons.
